LanguageDetector.summary: NOTE Experimental The LanguageDetector interface of the {{domxref("Translator and Language Detector APIs", "Translator and Language Detector APIs", "", "nocode")}} contains all the language detection functionality, including checking AI model availability, creating a new LanguageDetector instance, using it to detect a language, and more.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorAvailability.summary: NOTE Experimental The availability() static method of the interface returns an enumerated value that indicates whether the browser AI model supports a given LanguageDetector configuration.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorAvailability.returns: A that fulfills with an enumerated value indicating whether support is available (or will be available) for a given LanguageDetector configuration, or null if support could not be determined.Possible values include:

LanguageDetectorCreate.summary: NOTE Experimental The create() static method of the interface creates a new LanguageDetector instance to detect languages.

blockquote.para: The create() method requires transient activation, that is, it must be invoked in response to a user action such as a mouse click or button press.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorCreate.returns: A that fulfills with a LanguageDetector object instance.

LanguageDetectorDestroy.summary: NOTE Experimental The destroy() method of the interface releases the resources assigned to the LanguageDetector instance it is called on and stops any further activity on it. This means that any ongoing and subsequent method calls made on the LanguageDetector will reject with an AbortError.

remarks.para: It makes sense to destroy LanguageDetector objects if they are no longer being used, as they tie up significant resources in their handling.
-Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorDetect.summary: NOTE Experimental The detect() method of the interface detects the closest matching language or languages that a given text string is most likely to be written in.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorDetect.returns: A that fulfills with an array of objects representing the detected languages. Each object contains the following properties:The sum of all the returned confidence values should theoretically be 1, however, it may be lower because very low confidence values are excluded from the results.The last array element returned will always have a detectedLanguage value of und â€” this is an abbreviation of "undetermined", and represents the probability that the text is not written in a language the model knows.

LanguageDetectorExpectedInputLanguages.summary: NOTE Experimental The expectedInputLanguages read-only property of the interface returns the expected languages to be detected in the input text. Specifying expected input languages helps improve the accuracy of the language detection.

remarks.para: A LanguageDetector instance's expectedInputLanguages are set when creating it via a call.
-Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorExpectedInputLanguages.value: An array of strings specifying the expected input languages. These will be valid BCP 47 language tag.

LanguageDetectorInputQuota.summary: NOTE Experimental The inputQuota read-only property of the interface returns the input quota available to the browser for detecting languages.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorInputQuota.value: A number specifying the available input quota.This number is implementation-dependant. For example, it might be if there are no limits beyond the user's memory and the maximum length of JavaScript strings, or it might be a number of tokens in the case of AI models that use a token/credits scheme.The only guarantee is that inputQuota - will be non-negative if there is sufficient quota to detect the text's language.

LanguageDetectorMeasureInputUsage.summary: NOTE Experimental The measureInputUsage() method of the interface reports how much input quota would be used by a language detection operation for a given text input.

remarks.para: -Using the Translator and Language Detector APIs

LanguageDetectorMeasureInputUsage.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that fulfills with a number specifying the usage of the given input text.This number is implementation-dependant; if it is less than the , the string's language can be detected.
